title: Unable to open email attachments from trusted sources
content: Help please. Until yesterday, I was able to open email attachments from trusted sources. I work on vouchers to get people paid and it hasn't been a problem until now. If I open it up in a new tab, the voucher has hyro grifics (know its not spelled right)
creator: Mayfield7

title: Bookmarks not syncing: Skipping check of bookmarks - disabled via preferences
content:
Hi - I'm signed into firefox sync on two different computers, both running Ubuntu 20.04. I can tell that they're connected to the same account because I can see the other computer in the list for "Send tab to device".

However, the bookmarks aren't syncing - one computer has the full set, the other (newly set up) computer still has the default bookmarks.

When I check `about:sync-log`, I see these lines:

``` 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of prefs - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of passwords - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of tabs - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of bookmarks - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of addons - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of forms - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of history - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping check of extension-storage - disabled via preferences 1654551773179 Sync.Doctor INFO Skipping validation: no engines qualify 1654551773179 Sync.Status DEBUG Status.sync: success.sync => success.sync 1654551773179 Sync.Status DEBUG Status.service: success.status_ok => success.status_ok 1654551773180 Sync.Synchronizer INFO Sync completed at 2022-06-06 14:42:53 after 1.48 secs. ```

That is, it seems to think that bookmark syncing is disabled - however, I have bookmark syncing enabled, as you can see in the attached screenshot.
creator: pmolodowitch

title: View source in external brouser stopped working
content:
Firefox 102 beta stopped opening source of web pages in external editor

I have view_source.editor.external set to "true" and view_source.editor.path set to "C:\Program Files\Notepad++\notepad++.exe"

Before version 102, CTRL-U on any web page would open the page's source in the external editor.

In 102, the source is opened in the internal source viewer (in a browser tab).

The console shows: 

   this._caUtils.getDefaultExtension is not a function viewSourceUtils.js:413        getTemporaryFile chrome://global/content/viewSourceUtils.js:413        openInExternalEditor chrome://global/content/viewSourceUtils.js:265        openInExternalEditor chrome://global/content/viewSourceUtils.js:216        BrowserViewSourceOfDocument chrome://browser/content/browser.js:3131        BrowserViewSource chrome://browser/content/browser.js:3207        oncommand chrome://browser/content/browser.xhtml:1
creator: sync21

title: Saving web page usually fails, until retried
content:
I notice some reported this problem in 2020, in a post that's been archived.

I reported it previously in a different post, but I may not have provided enough information. I am using currently 91.10.0esr (64-bit) on openSUSE Leap 15.3 Linux.

When I right click on a web page, and choose "Save Page As..." from the menu that appears in response to the right click, then choose "Web Page, complete (*.htm *.html)" as how to save the page, Firefox goes through some process, something is placed on the disk drive. But often, the status of the download shows as "Failed". That is until I retry the download. I've even been able to "Show all downloads" and click on an icon to retry it, sometimes days or weeks later, without even re-visiting the web page which was originally saved, but after clicking on the icon to retry saving the page, the status shows as "Completed". It could just be an issue with Firefox reporting the status, rather than an actual failure.

Is this a "bug"/"error" in the program code for Firefox? If so, is there someway to report it, or will this post serve as such a report?

I'd appreciate any helpful thoughts.
creator: toes314

title: All bookmarks and tabs do not work on Firefox version 101
content:
All bookmarks and tabs will not open on Firefox version 101. I can only work in troubleshooting mode. I have re-installed an earlier version, but as soon as Firefox starts, it updates to 101. I am running a Windows 10 - 64 bit OS.

Can you please tell me a permanent fix that will allow me to run Firefox normally?

title: Samovolné pozastavení přehrávaného streamu
content: Dobrý den, při přehrávání některých streamů se v nepravidelných intervalech přehrávání pozastaví, jako kdyby bylo použito tlačítko pause. Pro pokračování přehrávání je nutno znovu použít tlačítko play. Prozatím jsem tento jev pozoroval na dvou webových stránkách - živého vysílání rozhlasové stanice radiožurnál - https://www.mujrozhlas.cz/zive/radiozurnal?autoplay=1 a na stránce internetové televize T-Mobile TV GO, ale třeba na Youtube a jiných se toto neděje. Na ostatních dvou strojích v domácnosti (s Windows 7 a 10) k tomuto jevu nedochází. Rychlost připojení je 1 Gbps oběma směry, použitý O.S. Windows 11 plně aktualizovaný a Firefox rovněž aktuální. Děkuji všem za pomoc. P.Milev
creator: milevpetr

title: Login help
content: My hard drive at home crashed. I attempted to login at work using my existing home account. My home email and password were-accepted and I was sent an authorization code to my home account email which I accessed at work. I entered the authorization code as instructed but still was not permitted to login. I was then sent another authorization code but still could not login. I am back at home now with a new hard drive trying to log in less than 24 hours after trying to login at work. Firefox now says the password is invalid. What is going on please? PS I am using a work account email and password that I just now created to be able to ask this question but I am on my home pc Thank you

title: Restore deleted browsing history
content:
I haven't deleted my browsing history since 2021 September, but I wish to restore browsing history from 2021Jan-2021Sep for some reasons.

I am using mac, latest version of macOS and latest version of firefox. I have read some similar articles (https://support.mozilla.org/fy-NL/questions/1290163) but it doesn't help. It says I need to go through "Start" > "Search" > "Tools" > "Folder Options." . I cannot find folder options, and I cannot find index.dat inside my mac. What can I do ? Any help is appreciated.

hey folks,

im also just using windows defender as antivir.

please elp, i'm out of ideas.

creator: gazzofr

title: Firefox totally dead
content: Hi, my Firefox on Win10 doesn't work, I've been forced to go back to Chrome. After a crash in Win10, Firefox doesn't work anymore: it opens, be it launched by me or by other programs, but it just sits there, blank, doing nothing. It is impossible to interact with menus and everything. Task Manager shows two open instances of the browser, using RAM, but the browser doesn't do anything. It doesn't "crash" and it doesn't freeze, it just stays like that. If I quit it and try opening it again the PC tells me it's open already, and Task Manager shows a couple instances staying there after quitting it, as if it stayed stuck. I tried resetting it from the Apps settings of Windows, but nothing happened, I tried uninstalling it and then installing it again, but nothing happened. Restarting the PC a couple of times changed nothing. In the end, I had to go back to Chrome and even put it as default browser because all programs were calling up Firefox which stayed unresponsive. Anybody knows what I should do in a case like this?
creator: nicola.m.ballestrin

title: Change in downloading behavior
content:
Suddenly, as of this morning, downloading is behaving differently-in a bad way.

• The first problem is that downloads are no longer showing their bit rate; I cannot tell how fast or slow a given download is progressing. I have different available servers and need to select the best for the situation.

• The second is that, upon completion of an mp4 download, my media player (VLC) opens the file and starts playing it, which didn't happen before. It's extremely distracting.

I can't find anything in Firefox preferences which might alter these behaviors.

I don't know enough about these particular events to know whether to attribute them to Firefox or to the website that is providing the files.

Hoping for assistance getting things back to where they were, with thanks…
creator: Etnier

title: OneDrive not working with Firefox Containers
content: I have used OneDrive with containers for several years for my clients. Recently I can't open OneDrive in a container, but I can open Outlook. Very frustrating. Any suggestions?

title: I've been locked out of Sync. Found recovery codes, but they don't work. Is there any way to gain access?
content:
Hello,

Yesterday I got signed out of my Firefox Sync and when I tried logging in, I realized I don't have Firefox in my authenticator app any longer. I have found Firefox recovery codes, which were issued in 2019 when I enabled 2FA, however when I try using them I get "Recovery code not found."

Can these recovery codes be used to prove my account ownership, even if I somehow generated new codes after 2019 but didn't save them (which I doubt, but it's not impossible) ?

I am not logged in on any other device so I cannot disable the 2FA that way. Is there any hope?
creator: tagree

title: Question about Touchpad gestures.
content:
Can I please know the command to activate the two finger left swipe to go back in Firefox and the right swipe to go forward, please?

Regards, Labeeb.
creator: labeeb3626

title: embedded BING extension in Firefos and Nightly
content: About two weeks ago, Microsoft sent me a recommendation for using Bing extension. Thinking it was fine, I proceeded as an idiot to install. At the last moment, it stated it will be the homepage or some such thing, So, I hit "cancel". But, no sooner than clicking it, Bing installed itself. But, now when I start Firefox, it opens FOUR separate tabs every single time, including my email home page and Bing related pages, including the one that asks me if I uninstalled by mistake. I can never get rid of these tabs unless I close them one by one every time. I even tried refreshing Firefox by getting rid of all my add-ons. But, even that only worked for about literally 2seconds or less as Firefox restarted without Bing pages and, then, just like virus, all three pages loaded themselves again. Is there anyway to get rid of this hijacking function, that is, OFFICIAL Microsoft Bing extension??? https://browserdefaults.microsoft.com/extensions/feedback_v2/index.html?extnID=%7b3e06d96e-26f5-4a68-ac64-2b6bc583a35d%7d&mkt=en-us&mid=C6C4A3866D8ACFCA49ED3C14E3031E0D&br=mf Sorry, I couldn't upload photos for some reason.
creator: misosiru

title: Info apertura pagine continua

title: firefox stopped working only on my pc user
content: Hello, I haven't been able to get Firefox to work for 2 days, after completely uninstalling the program and installing it several times, it still doesn't work, the only thing left is a black screen and it doesn't respond, the strange thing is that in safe mode it works and if I close the user interface of my session PC and I open another, Firefox does work, but I don't know what the error could be, I already tried almost all the solutions on the web and nothing, the program is virgin without add-ons or extra configurations, also if I close it, the program keeps running in the background and you have to force it to stop with the task manager, I would really appreciate an answer
creator: ramiroreywar

title: I accidentally hit restore in my bookmarks library and deleted all my bookmarks
content: So we had to reset my laptop and I had to redownload all my apps, including firefox, which thinks this is a new computer. When I was trying to mess with my history to pull up some old tabs I lost, I accidentally hit the restore button in the import and backup section in the library tag, not realizing that it would delete ALL my bookmarks. I tried hitting Undue but it didn't help. Is there a way to get them back? I lost a lot...
creator: azriellaveraon

title: Sams club website saying that firefox is unsupported works in chrome ok
content: I used to have no issues with this site www.samsclub.com but a few months ago it started to say that my up to date firefox was unsupported. Chrome works just fine. I did a firefox refresh with no joy. I use ABP and no script on both chrome and firefox and on both browsers i have disabled them for sams club, chrome works and firefox still says unsupported. I have tried user agent switcher, various configurations with no joy. I have turned off avast. no joy.

I'm very confused by why this is happening, as i've tried multiple ways to fix it to no avail.

Any help will be greatly appreciated. Thanks.
